summary: An FBI Child Sex Tourism Travel Advisory notifying the Legal Attach√© in Paris that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Edward Epstein is planning to travel to France from September 24 to October 5, 2016. The advisory provides Epstein's itinerary, physical description, and passport details, and notes no action is required.

events.title: Epstein's Conviction
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was convicted of procuring a person under the age of 18 for prostitution.

events.title: Epstein's Departure for France
events.description: Epstein is scheduled to depart from New York, New York by private aircraft (N212JE) and arrive at Le Bourget Airport in Paris, France at approximately 8:30 pm local time.

events.title: Epstein's Scheduled Return from France
events.description: Epstein is scheduled to return from France.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted on June 30, 2008, of procuring a person under 18 for prostitution.
In September 2016, the FBI issued a travel advisory notifying French authorities that Epstein planned to travel to France from September 24 to October 5, 2016.
Epstein's travel itinerary included a private aircraft (tail number N212JE) and an address in Paris (22 Avenue Foch).
The FBI advisory explicitly states 'No action is required' and is for informational purposes only.
The advisory was prepared by the FBI's Violent Crimes Against Children Section, Major Case Coordination Unit.
